definition: many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"

sentences.english: Naturally, Wolowitz is overcome with paranoia and insecurity.
sentences.chinese: 洛維茲自然會變得多疑而沒有安全感嘍。

sentences.english: Or is it just one of 72 fake graves built by the suspicious Cao Cao?
sentences.chinese: 抑或生性多疑的曹操真有七十二疑冢？

sentences.english: My paranoid supporters thought I’d been set up by somebody.
sentences.chinese: 我的一些多疑的支持者們認爲我是被某人算計了。

sentences.english: Let me tell you, I was skeptical.
sentences.chinese: 告訴你們吧，我是個多疑的人。

sentences.english: People who trade gold are the most paranoiac on the planet.
sentences.chinese: 買黃金的人是地球上最多疑的人。

sentences.english: His eyes were set very deep in his head, and were disagreeably sharp and suspicious.
sentences.chinese: 眼睛凹下去很深，目光銳利多疑，讓人看了不舒服。

sentences.english: Skeptical and dull living beings might ask that.
sentences.chinese: 多疑的鈍根衆生，也許會這樣地問，可是呢？

sentences.english: LL: Li Hua, are you giving me the runaround ?
sentences.chinese: 看你說的，偶乍樣是在找藉口呢偶看你有點多疑吧。

sentences.english: Cunning suspicious of her to Ye Lingqing again after the beat about the bush.
sentences.chinese: 之後，狡猾多疑的她又對葉凌青旁敲側擊。

sentences.english: A suspicious husband hired a private eye to check on the movements of his wife.
sentences.chinese: 有位多疑的老公僱了個私家偵探，調查老婆的行蹤。

sentences.english: Some people are introvert, exceedingly is fuggy , disposition is eccentric, suspicious much Lv.
sentences.chinese: 有些人性格內向，好生悶氣，脾氣古怪，多疑多慮。

sentences.english: Your empty promises are lost on the skeptical consumer.
sentences.chinese: 你的空頭許諾對於多疑的客戶來說毫無用途。

sentences.english: LL: Li Hua, are you giving me the runaround?
sentences.chinese: 看你說的，我怎麼是在找藉口呢？我看你有點多疑吧。

sentences.english: The skeptical Pelle had a look around the surrounding environment.
sentences.chinese: 生性多疑的小秋巡視了一圈周邊環境。

sentences.english: After my awakening, I have become paranoid.
sentences.chinese: 我突然覺醒後便變得多疑。

definition: to be suspicious and jealous of
deceitful in many ways (idiom); wily and mischievous/full of craft and cunning
to act impetuously (idiom); on an impulse
